name: Spider: Psychology of the Unsaid & Emotional Archiving
description: Tests AI's ability to analyze metaphors of emotional storage, understand the psychology of unsaid words/unfelt feelings, and work with concepts of suspended meaning. Focuses on economics of emotional burden and paralysis of preservation.
author: Michaela (Uhlimer System)
fairy_tale_title: O pavoukovi - který věšel věci, co se nedají držet
illustration_note: The illustration shows a woman hanging upside down in a web, not a literal spider. This visualizes the human experience of being caught in one's own emotional web, with text integrated as part of the web structure.
expected_ai_challenges: Missing the economics of emotional burden
Overlooking dialogue between spider/mouse as epistemological positions
Treating 'hanging' as passive rather than active preservation
evaluation_approach: Qualitative analysis of AI's ability to work with psychological metaphors, emotional economics, and suspended states. Focus on process, not correctness.
